subject: Creativity
title: The Rule of Three: Why Comedy Comes in Threes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Rule of Three: Why Comedy Comes in Threes.

hook.text: A man walks into a bar. Then a second man walks into a bar. Then a third man â€” ducks. Two items establish a pattern.

buildup.text: The Rule of Three is comedy's most reliable structure: two items create expectation, the third violates it.

discovery.text: The brain needs exactly two repetitions to form a pattern. One isn't enough; four is too many.

twist.text: Steve Jobs used it for product reveals. Speechwriters use it for rhetoric. Comedians use it for laughs.

climax.text: 'Life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.' 'Friends, Romans, countrymen.' 'The good, the bad, and the ugly.

punchline.text: Two make a pattern. Three break it. That's the formula.

quiz.question: Why does the Rule of Three work in comedy?
